issue.title: [C++] GcsFileSystem should use metadata to distinguish directory markers
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-15114](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15114). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
GcsFileSystem is using files ending with `/` as directory markers.  As described in ARROW-14924 this does not work when one wants to avoid creating a directory named `foo` (or `foo/`) if a file named `foo` already exists.
